overview:
Undiscovered entrepreneur and businessman. I have a lot of solid growth ideas which I hope to fortify in the next 30 years.

In October 2011, I started a web-based voting system for California called Votence (www.votence.com). I also wrote the Braille Deck application (www.brailledeck.co.cc), and the eFax Mobile app.

Previous employment includes mobile web / software development for j2 Global Inc, quality assurance for Kaseya LLC, and telemarketing for ACS (a Xerox company).

I have a Biochemistry degree (B.S.) with honors from the University of California, Santa Barbara; and an Engineering degree (A.S. level) from Santa Rosa, Junior College. Additionally, I have 3 years research experience in molecular nanotechnology - which included a stint at the California Nanosystems Institute.

I also have a strong business background that includes: start-up and corporate management theory, financial and managerial accounting, business law and negotiations, valuation, national sales experience and selling hi-technology theory, business statistics, and human resources.

And I also have a strong computer science background that includes knowledge of the following software languages: Java (Android, Grails, Jenkins, and Jetty), C/C++ (Make, Arduino/Chipkit, Lex/Yacc), Javascript (jQuery / jQ Mobile & qUnit, CoffeScript, Node, Backbone) and other languages (Assembly, Python, PHP, and Haskell).

Lastly, I pride myself as a “gifted dsylexic” and because of that I have become fluent in American Sign Language and English Braille (Grade 2).
